page.title: 09OUNDLE - THE SOUTH ROAD AREA
page.content: Our survey took us along South Road to the junction with Barnwell Road and down as far as the old mill which is now a restaurant called Barnwell Mill.We then returned to school along the old towpath by the River Nene, thus making a round trip of some 2.25 miles. South Road is mainly residential. There are however certain fine examples of the old industries which existed in Oundle including the old malthouse and one of the four breweries. An old warehouse, now converted into flats, was also seen.The vet is housed in an old school building on South Road and hold three surgeries each day from Monday to Friday - 9-9.30a.m., 2-2.30p.m. and 6-6.30p.m. There is also a Saturday surgery at 9.00a.m. Just over the Thrapston Road bridge is Oundle Marina.
